description: Art historians long identiﬁed the subject of this painting as a beggar boy; however, it is now believed to portray the artist’s oldest child, Giacomo, in the costume of a pilgrim bound for Santiago de Compostela, Spain, where the apostle James reputedly settled. Carrying a loaf of bread and a rosary, Giacomo sports the hat and staff of a Santiago pilgrim.
title: The Beggar Boy (The Young Pilgrim)
